title: Tuk Tuk fare for second km increased to Rs.50
body_lines: Along with the recent fuel price increase, the All-Island Three-Wheeler Drivers' Union (AITWDU) said that the three wheeler fare should be increased, AITWDU President Lalith Dharmasekera said.
Therefore, they have decided to increase the fare of the second km to Rs.50.
Earlier, we introduced Rs. 80 and Rs. 45 for the first and second km to protect the three wheeler industry. (Chaturanga Samarawickrama)
